"Funeral" of S. Korea-U.S. FTA Held in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement reportedly held a "funeral" of the FTA in Seoul on June 9.
 Speakers at the "funeral" said that the conclusion of FTA would entail adverse aftermath little short of the crisis caused by the International Monetary Fund, adding that the people would certainly punish the present government for driving them to an abyss of death.    
 After a "memorial address" was read out, its participants held a "funeral," holding funeral streamers and placards reading "FTA that makes a mess of the south Korean economy and deepens the bipolarization of society" and so on.

Chinese Delegation Here
   Pyongyang, June 13 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Chinese Academy of Sciences headed by Executive Vice-President Bai Chunli arrived here Tuesday.
 It was met at the airport by an official concerned and the Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
